extracted_data: {"source": "BofA Global Investment Strategy, Bloomberg", "data_source": "BofA Global Investment Strategy, Bloomberg", "asset_class": "equities", "used_data": "Chart 9: Annual central bank policy rate cuts forecasted over next 2 years (number of cuts per year from 2007-2025). Chart 10: Japan TOPIX Index historical performance from 1982 to November 2024, showing the index level over time with key peaks marked in December 1989 and November 2025.", "what_happened": "Chart 9 shows a dramatic decline in expected policy rate cuts for the next 2 years, dropping from 81 cuts forecasted in 2024 to only 19 cuts expected in 2025, representing a steep reduction in anticipated monetary easing. Chart 10 shows the TOPIX Index reaching an all-time high in November 2025 at approximately 3,900, surpassing the previous peak of around 3,000 set in December 1989 (the famous bubble-era high).", "interpretation": "The sharp reduction in expected rate cuts suggests markets are pricing in a more hawkish central bank stance or stronger economic conditions that require less monetary accommodation. The TOPIX breaking above its 1989 peak after 36 years is historically significant, indicating Japanese equities have finally recovered from the post-bubble era and may reflect improved corporate governance, structural reforms, inflation dynamics, or renewed investor confidence in Japanese markets."}
